titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Breukelen, Netherlands collection 2007.014
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:10 +0000.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Municipal Club of Brooklyn (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn Heights Garden Club (Brooklyn Heights, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: This collection contains items from a trip to Breukelen, the Netherlands, made by members the Municipal Club of Brooklyn in 1929. Items include photographs, lists of visitors, a menu, a commemorative announcement, and a color woodcut print produced by artist Hans Matthes, of Breukelen. The collection also contains a faded child's skirt, donated by the Brooklyn Heights Garden Club in care packages sent to Breukelen in 1945 at the end of World War II, and one related clipping.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Breukelen (Netherlands) collection, 2007.014, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photographs will enter the public domain in 2049.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains items from a trip to Breukelen, the Netherlands, made by members the Municipal Club of Brooklyn in 1929. Items include photographs, lists of visitors, a menu, a commemorative announcement, and a color woodcut print produced by artist Hans Matthes, of Breukelen.
The collection also contains a faded child's skirt, donated by the Brooklyn Heights Garden Club in care packages sent to Breukelen in 1945 at the end of World War II, and one related clipping.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn neighborhood associations and civic organizations publications, 1881-2008 (ARC.167)

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Digitized versions of the photographs are available via the image database located in the library. Please consult library staff for more details.
